text: Heavy-duty mandate watch: a State Senate committee has unanimously reported out a massively costly proposal to lock in government retiree health benefits. https://www.empirecenter.org/publications/senate-moves-massive-mandate/ …

text: For those keeping score at home, @NYGovCuomo had a simplistic and self-serving response to this simplistic and self-serving op-ed by @SenRickScott. https://www.wsj.com/articles/why-new-yorkers-flee-for-florida-11553122015?shareToken=st4483cddecb1e4ba5b6036b72c2237513 … via @WSJ
author: EjmEj

text: According to its last bond offering statement, Amsterdam hasn't even calculated its unfunded liability for OPEB. What's really needed here is a financial control board, but @NYGovCuomo won't agree to create one. (Unions hate them.)
author: EjmEj

text: Inadvertently cut off source citation on this @EmpireCenter chart. Percentages derived from the NYS Department of Taxation and Finance "analysis of personal income tax" data for the years indicated.
author: EjmEj

text: No.  You'd need to ask NJ treasury department.
author: EjmEj

text: Resident share of NY taxpayers in >$1 million brackets has declined sharply since early 2000s—w/steepest drop at tippy-top. Nonresidents are taxed only on what they earn from work/business in NY, not on investment gains or income earned in other states.
author: EjmEj

text: Cue this chart as a reminder of why still-higher taxes on highest earners would be an especially bad idea in NY.  It made us exceptionally susceptible to swings in high-earner incomes even before SALT cap—now risks are more pronounced.
author: EjmEj

text: Update: @jdavidgoodman of @nytimes notes that he personally tweeted about having been turned away from Cuomo fundraiser on afternoon it was held.
author: EjmEj

text: Fair enough. Had not seen your tweet (just clicked "Follow," though), but by "ignored elsewhere" I meant actual media outlets — i.e., the paper —as opposed to social media.  If wrong on that, apology duly extended.
author: EjmEj

text: Story on Cuomo’s unpublicized but conveniently budget-timed NYC fundraiser appeared in @nypost — but seems to have been ignored elsewhere. 2/2
author: EjmEj

text: Story in @nytimes on “just another night” of legislative fundraising in Albany doesn’t mention @NYGovCuomo’s own, *much* more expensive fundraiser a week ago in NYC, where attendees included lobbyists for marijuana, unions and hospitals. 1/2 https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/20/nyregion/lobbyists-albany-legislature.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share … via @NYTimes
author: EjmEj

text: Keep in mind that @NYGovCuomo wants to fully dedicate the money for MTA capital bonding. Bondholders will want huge coverage ratio. 2/2
author: EjmEj

text: Key reason for a much lower pied a terre revenue estimate: "We have an overpriced market with too much to sell. This could easily worsen that." 1/2 https://www.crainsnewyork.com/real-estate/real-estate-execs-argue-pied-terre-tax-would-bring-less-what-supporters-claim … via @CrainsNewYork
author: EjmEj

text: The "millennials are coming back" story is over-hyped. Buff-NF region as a whole can't seem to grow workforce, despite affordability.

text: So, they are only $3.3b apart. Based on the actual bills, it’s hard to see how either estimate could be correct.

text: Turns out Senate Dems have posted a financial plan summary online, estimating their budget bills would add a net $181 million to the Executive Budget—not quite the $3.5 bn @NYGovCuomo’s budget director asserts. https://www.nysenate.gov/sites/default/files/open-data/fy_2020_financial_plan.pdf …
author: EjmEj

text: Nope -- 24 hrs later, Senate Dem report incl financial summary of one-house budget still not posted anywhere, as best as I can tell. Which, given attacks by @NYGovCuomo and GOP for over-spending, is not a good look.  @LizKrueger
